body:
Release 0.11.0 contains the following fixes and changes to continuous integration build.

**Additions**

* Add example tweak header.
* Add `make_span()` taking `std::initializer_list` (#74).
* Add special-case test with empty il for MSVC120/VS2013 (#74).
* Add GitHub Actions CI ([nonstd-lite-project issue 55](https://github.com/martinmoene/nonstd-lite-project/issues/55)).
* Add/update example/CMakeLists.txt ([nonstd-lite-project issue 56](https://github.com/martinmoene/nonstd-lite-project/issues/56)).
* Add construction from `std::initializer_list<>` as per p2447 (#74, thanks @Pesa, [p2447](https://wg21.link/p2447) - std::span and the missing constructor).
* Add p2447 on missing constructor to section References (#74, [p2447](https://wg21.link/p2447) - std::span and the missing constructor).

**Changes**

* Update actions/checkout in GitHub Actions to v4 (#82, thanks @striezel).
* Update actions/checkout in GitHub Actions to v3 (#75).
* Remove Travis CI configuration and badge (#80, thanks @striezel).
* Remove gcc 8 and clang 8, 9, 10 from GitHub CI matrix ([nonstd-lite-project issue 69](https://github.com/martinmoene/nonstd-lite-project/issues/69)).
* Remove msvc (windows-2016) image from GitHub Actions ([nonstd-lite-project issue 61](https://github.com/martinmoene/nonstd-lite-project/issues/61), thanks @xavier2k6).
* Add msvc (windows-2022) image to GitHub Actions ([nonstd-lite-project issue 62](https://github.com/martinmoene/nonstd-lite-project/issues/62)).
* Do not cancel all jobs in a workflow if one fails (#79, thanks @striezel, [nonstd-lite-poject issue 71](https://github.com/martinmoene/nonstd-lite-project/issues/71).
* Use toplevel unit_name ([nonstd-lite-project 56](https://github.com/martinmoene/nonstd-lite-project/issues/56)).
* Change value used with `*_CPP20_OR_GREATER` to 202002L ([nonstd-lite-project issue 49](https://github.com/martinmoene/nonstd-lite-project/issues/49)).  
  Now, designate C++23 as speculative.
* Replace #pragma warning suppression by in-body initialization (#74, thanks @Pesa).
* Only suppress warning -Winit-list-lifetime for GCC 9 and later (#74, thanks @Pesa).
* Exclude clang from GGC warning -Winit-list-lifetime (#74).
* Suppress GGC warning -Winit-list-lifetime (#74, thanks @Pesa).
* Restore default off for `span_FEATURE_WITH_INITIALIZER_LIST_P2447` (#74).
* Move constructor for `std::initializer_list` down (#74).
* Ensure to point to first element of array (MS Code Analysis, decay).
* Ensure sufficient lifetime for span (#74).
* Change initializer_list tests to use sections (#74).
* Only provide non-explicit variant for MSVC120/VS2013 (#74).
* Update table for p2447 (#74).


**Fixes**

* Fix C++standard version for `[[noreturn]]` to C++11 (#83, thanks @simark).
* Fix to import `std::dynamic_extent` into `nonstd` when selecting `std::span` (#81, thanks @wendazhou).
* Fix a small typo (#78, thanks @striezel).
* Fix cmake config file (#77, thanks  @duncanspumpkin).
* Fix span-lite tests on big-endian (#76, thanks @jpcima).

Release 0.10.3 fixes #69 and #73.

**Fixes:**

- Properly constrain constructor from iterators (fixes #69, thanks @krsch).
- Add `[noreturn]` to `throw_out_of_range()` (fixes #73, thanks @jdumas).

Release 0.9.2 fixes #64. Thanks to  @improbablejan.

**Note:** With MSVC Debug, a span cannot be created from an empty range, like: `std::vector v; span(v.begin(),v.end())`.
This behaviour is present since the introduction of construction from iterators in [v0.9.0](https://github.com/martinmoene/span-lite/releases/tag/v0.9.0).

**Note:** this release still has problems, see #64 .

Release 0.9.1 fixes #64. Thanks to  @improbablejan.

Release 0.9.0 of *span lite* adds construction from iterators and improves detection of the presence of Class Template Argument Deduction (CTAD).

*Additions:*

- Construct a span from two iterators or an iterator and a size with C++11 and later (#61, thanks @Ryan-rsm-McKenzie).

*Changes:*

- Improve detection of the presence of C++17 Class Template Argument Deduction (CTAD, #48).

*Fixes:*

- Fix to only use scoped enums with C++11 and later .

This bug-fix release of *span lite* contains the following changes.

**Fixes:**

- Fix span iterator deduction guide (#61, thanks @Ryan-rsm-McKenzie)

**Changes:**

- Add more tests for construction via deduction guides
- Add Visual Studio 2019 to the Appveyor build matrix
- Remove Visual Studio 9 2008 from AppVeyor CI
- Deactivate allow_failures on Travis

This release of *span lite* contains the following changes and fixes.

**Additions**

- Add span iterator deduction guide (#61, thanks @Ryan-rsm-McKenzie)
- Add 'Tweak header' support via `<nonstd/span.tweak.hpp>`, see [nonstd-lite-project 44](https://github.com/martinmoene/nonstd-lite-project/issues/44)
- Add TortoiseGit integration with GitHub issues
- Add `.editorconfig`, `.gitattributes`

**Changes**

- Change 'on conan' link to refer to conan center
- Prevent `-Wtype-limits` for index check (#62, #63, thanks @mjacobse)
- Avoid MSVC 14.1 (VS 2017) warning C4307 (#59, thanks @vlovich)
- For MSVC 12.0 (VS2013, _MSC_VER:1800) fall back on previous behavior of `span_REQUIRES_T()`

**Fixes**

- Fix construction from empty arrays in debug modes(#57, thanks to @mjacobse)
- Fix enabling of default constructor for `extent == 0` (#56, thanks to @herv)
- Fix compile errors with clang10 and libc++ (#55, thanks to @AndWass, @Arghnews)
- Fix implementation of `span_REQUIRES_T()`, see [nonstd-lite-project 40](https://github.com/martinmoene/nonstd-lite-project/issues/40)

*To be further edited*

This release contains the following changes and fixes.

**Additions**

- Add std::tuple_size<>, std::tuple_element<>, std::get(spn) (#30)
- Add tuple_element_t for C++11 and newer (#51)

**Changes**

- Change default of span_FEATURE_COMPARISON to 0 (#30)
- Change defaults of span_CONFIG_EXTENT_TYPE, span_CONFIG_SIZE_TYPE to std::size_t (#30)
- Rename as_writeable_bytes() to as_writable_bytes() (#30, thanks to @nolange)
- Rename index_type to size_type, p1872 (#30, thanks to @ThePhD); p1872 - span should have size_type, not index_type
- [skip ci] Improve MSVC version table (nonstd-lite-project issue 38); https://github.com/martinmoene/nonstd-lite-project/issues/38
- Avoid std::equal volatile comparisons for libc++ (#44); libc++ doesn't allow us to perform std::equal on volatile and non-volatile types. We can work around this by iterating over the span and manually comparing.
- Introduce span_CONFIG_EXTENT_TYPE, fix constraint (thanks to @ThePhD)
- Use #include in code on Godbolt (#49)
- Suppress clang's warning -Wmismatched-tags (#50, thanks to @vlovich)
- Skip tuple_element_t test for VS2013 (#51)
- Readme: Add several ISO C++ Committee Trip Reports
- Readme: Point to conan-center (thanks @flexferrum)
- Readme: Improve Readme guided by markdownlint

**Fixes**

- Fix type for array sizes to std::size_t
- Use span_constexpr, span_noexcept with structured bindings (#30)
- Provide base templates of tuple_size, tuple_element (#30); also remove && variants of get<>(spn)
- Fix span_HAVE_DEDUCTION_GUIDES for MSVC (#38, thanks to @melak47), Use span_COMPILER_MSVC_VER instead of span_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION
- Use 'class' for tuple_size, tuple_element (#50, thanks to @vlovich)
- Fix typo in INDEX_TYPE deprecation note; span_CONFIG_INDEX_TYPE was changed to span_CONFIG_SIZE_TYPE in 0c95c299 but due to a typo, this was not described correctly in the README.md

name: Release 0.6.0
body: This release prepares `nonstd::span_lite` to include into main conan-index repository.

[to be expanded]

This release of *span lite* improves support for [CMake](https://cmake.org) and [Conan](https://conan.io/) and contains numerous other changes and fixes.

See also *nonstd lite* project [Improve coherence between lite projects](https://github.com/martinmoene/nonstd-lite-project/projects/1).

This release ....

**Additions**
- Introduced C++ standard selection macro `span_CPLUSPLUS`.
- Introduced `span_lite_MAJOR`, `-MINOR`, `-PATCH`, `-VERSION`.
- Introduced `span_SPAN_DEFAULT`, `span_SPAN_NONSTD`, `span_SPAN_STD`.
- Introduced `span_CONFIG()`.
- Added non-member versions of `first()`, `last()` and `subspan()` per p1024 (issue #13 ).
- Added member `at(index_t)`, `span_FEATURE_MEMBER_AT` (issue #14)
- Enabled compilation without exceptions, `span_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS` (issue #14).
- Enabled detection and use of `(non)std::byte` via `as_[writeable_]bytes()` (issue #28, thanks to @ilyalesokhin).
- Added CMake installation and config-file packaging (issue #29, [nonstd-lite plan 8](https://github.com/martinmoene/nonstd-lite-project/issues/13), thanks to @gracicot).
- Added [script to update version](https://github.com/martinmoene/span-lite/blob/master/script/update-version.py).

**Changes**
- Changed selection of *span* to use `span_CONFIG_SELECT_SPAN=span_SPAN_DEFAULT` etc. 
- Differentiated span's template parameter types between `extent_t` and `index_t`.
- Introduced `span_CONFIG_INDEX_TYPE` to specify `index_t`. The default is `std::ptrdiff_t`, but this will change to `std::size_t` as in C++20 in the near future (issue #21).
- Deprecated `operator()()`, introduced `span_FEATURE_MEMBER_CALL_OPERATOR` (purpose: migration).
- Renamed macros to `span_FEATURE_MEMBER_BACK_FRONT`, `span_FEATURE_MEMBER_SWAP` (issue #14).
- Renamed `span_CONFIG_CONTRACT_CHECK()` to `span_CONTRACT_CHECK()` (issue #14).
- Renamed `span_CONFIG_PROVIDE...` to `span_FEATURE...` (issue #14).
- Added contract check to `front()`, `back()` (issue #14).
- Updated lest test framework to v1.33.5.
- Handle AppleClang separately in build.
- Expanded Travis configuration.
- Report ctest failures.

**Fixes**
- Obviate need for `-DNOMINMAX` with MSVC ([nonstd-lite issue 16](https://github.com/martinmoene/nonstd-lite-project/issues/16)).
- Fixed to allow `Offset` to be equal to `Size` (PR #26, thanks to @markazmierczak).
- Fixed subviews return value (PR #25, thanks to @ericLemanissier).
- Removed unused span_HAVE_INLINE_NAMESPACE (thanks @feroldi, issue #24).
- Ensured `..._THROWS_V` is defined (thanks @feroldi, issue #24).
- Fixed missing include directory (thanks to @meldavis, issue #23).
- Fixed includes for std::boolalpha (issue #17, thanks to @nolange).
- Fixed clang 5.0, 6.0 compilation error (issue #17, thanks to @nolange).
- Fixed usage of long long and of std::snprintf() (issue #16, thanks to @nolange).
- Removed dependency on std string and stream (issue #16, thanks to @nolange).
- Fixed `span_CONFIG_CONTRACT_CHECK` for contract-violation-terminates, (issue #15).
- Ensured `span_HAVE_...` are defined (issue #14).

*span lite* has been re-licensed under the [Boost Software License (BSL)](https://github.com/martinmoene/span-lite/blob/master/LICENSE.txt) (issue #11).

Further, this release contains the following changes.

**Changes**
* Expressed c/begin() and c/end() in data().
* Differentiated hiding of issues via [hide] from configuration info via [. ...].

**Additions**
* Added member swap(), span_CONFIG_PROVIDE_SWAP.
* Introduced span_PROVIDE(), span_PROVIDE_TO_STD().
* Introduced span_CPLUSPLUS_V for C++ standard version.

**Fixes**
* Fixed exception thrown with span_CONFIG_CONTRACT_VIOLATION_THROWS=1 (issue #10).
* Fixed operator==() (issue #6).

This release of *span lite* contains the following changes.

**Changes**
* Activate tests for all configurable items in CMake configuration.
* Changed to use `span_CONFIG_PROVIDE_MAKE_SPAN_TO_STD`, see Additions.
* Enable class template argument deduction guides, except for MSVC.
* Improve on `constexpr`.
* Include allocator type for `std::vector`.
* Provide `make_span()` and `byte_span()` also to `std::span` if requested.
* Parenthesize macro arguments (thanks to PVS-Studio).
* Prevent warning on comparing differently signed integers [`-Wsign-compare`].
* Update *lest_cpp03.hpp* to v1.33.1.

**Additions**
* Add `span_CONFIG_PROVIDE_BYTE_SPAN`.
* Add `span_CONFIG_PROVIDE_MAKE_SPAN_TO_STD`.
* Add `span_CONFIG_PROVIDE_WITH_CONTAINER_TO_STD`.
* Add `span_CONFIG_PROVIDE_BACK_FRONT`, see below.
* Add `span_CONFIG_PROVIDE_SAME`, see below.
* Add `span_CONFIG_PROVIDE_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_STDARRAY_ELEMENT_TYPE`, see below.
* Add non-standard functions `back()` and `front()` controlled via `span_CONFIG_PROVIDE_BACK_FRONT` (issue #3, thanks to @chris0e3) .
* Add non-standard function `same()` controlled via `span_CONFIG_PROVIDE_SAME` (issue #3, thanks to @chris0e3) .
* Add non-standard `byte_span()` creator functions (issue #3, thanks to @chris0e3).
* Add control for non-standard construction from `std::array` with const data controlled via `span_CONFIG_PROVIDE_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_STDARRAY_ELEMENT_TYPE`.
* Add failing test for span comparison, issue #3 (thanks to @chris0e3) span comparison are not up to date with /heterogeneous/ comparisons introduced in p0122r7.
* Add `make_span( with_container_t, ...)`.
* Add *script/t-all.bat* to compile with a selection of features.
* Add p0805 and libc++ span snippet to Readme.

**Fixes**
* Fix closing parenthesis in disabled line of `as_bytes()` and `as_writeable_bytes()` (issue #3, thanks to @chris0e3).
* Fix compilation with features disabled.
* Fix construction from container for VC12 (VS2013).
* Fix missing `#include <algorithm>` (issue #3, thanks to @chris0e3).
* Fix missing `#include <cstdint>` by avoiding the need for it.
* Fix missing using of `as_bytes()` and `as_writeable_bytes()` (issue #3, thanks to @chris0e3).
* Fix `nssv_` prefix to `span_`.
* Fix span comparisons to be heterogeneous as per issue #3 (thanks to @chris0e3).
* Fix usage of `std::enable_if<>` (thanks to ReSharper).
* Fix warning suppression to include `make_span()` and `byte_span()` for now; 
  Needs work when `std::span` is used with `make_span()` and `byte_span()`.
Initial release of span, based on propasal [p0122r7](http://wg21.link/p0122r7), and present in [working draft](http://eel.is/c++draft/span.syn).
